page.title: 19POLICE&FIRE SERVICE,WARGRAVE
page.content:
P.C.Girton has been in the{Police {Force}20 years.His job in a village is comparable with being in a town as he has similar responsibility. His area is greater than a town beat but less busy and less populated.It means he can get to know more people especially as he was on the Youth Club Committee and is Chairman of the Bowls Club.He lives in the Police House in Wargrave.
When he was 16 years old Tony Annetts was the third generation of his family to serve the Wargrave community by becoming a part-time{Fire Officer.}He wears protective clothing when called out on duty.Fire officers use special equipment and breathing apparatus when necessary.The village fire service is often called out to assist at big fires and accidents over a wide area for example in Reading and Bracknell.
